Mike Bowler got me in the habit of using 'final' where possible, so I asked=
 him to read the article. Here is his response.

>J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
=
>> This came up in the JUnit mailing list. I don't know whether you've
>> a=
lready read it. It might change your use of 'final'.
>
>I hadn't read it bu=
t it doesn't change anything for me :-)
>
>My main reason for using final i=
s to better explain my *intent* to the 
>compiler.  This gives the compiler=
 the opportunity to....
>
>1) Provide better warning messages when I make a=
 mistake
>2) Generate faster code
>
>The first is significantly more import=
ant to me than the second.  Real 
>performance increases will come from cha=
nging algorithms, not inlining 
>methods.
>
>Having said that, I do occasio=
nally get hung up on performance and tune 
>places that really aren't helpi=
ng that much but nobody's perfect :-)
>
>-- 
>Mike Bowler

yle Software Inc.
